0: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C. — In her first public appearance since being fired from The New York Times, Jill Abramson focused on resilience during personal setbacks. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Abramson, who was dismissed Wednesday as the paper’s executive editor, opened her commencement address at Wake Forest University by recounting a conversation she had with her sister the morning after her firing. Her sister, she said, reminded her of a key piece of advice from their father that Abramson then passed on to the graduates: “You know the sting of losing or not getting something you badly want. When that happens show what you are made of,” she said.
